name: Uncharmed: Untangling Iran's APT42 Operations
description: A mapping of the TTPs identified to APT42 operation

techniques.comment: APT42 has been observed using spear-phishing links in order to deliver legitimate documents or invitations to conferences, further enabling them to harvest credentials
In order to gain initial access to the victim's network, APT42 has been observed to pose as journalists and event organizers, aiming to build trust with victims through ongoing correspondence
APT42 has been observed issuing Windows native commands through the Windows Command Shell during data exfiltration
APT42 was observed staging files for exfiltration in password-protected 7-ZIP archives
APT42 has been observed using AES encryption to encrypt data for impact
APT42 was observed exploiting this technique, exfiltrating files to a OneDrive account masquerading as the victim’s organization
APT42 was observed deploying two custom backdoors namely NICECURL and TAMECAT, providing an access point to various clients for further execution of commands

APT42 has been observed using various built-in features and publicly available tools to evade their defense. They were also seen clearing Google Chrome browser history and using anonymized infrastructure to interact with the victim's environment
APT42 leveraged social engineering to gain access to victim networks and discover cloud services for credential harvesting

The TAMECAT backdoor initially writes a likely victim identifier to a location and makes an initial POST request to a C2 domain. If the response is successful, the decrypted response data is later split into four values.
This indicates potential phishing through attachment
